paper_abstract: We investigate the computational complexity of some basic problems regarding non-unique probe selection using separable matrices. In particular, we prove that the minimal (d) over bar -separable matrix problem is DP-complete, and the (d) over bar -separable submatrix with reserved rows problem, which is a generalization of the decision version of the minimum (d) over bar -separable submatrix problem, is Sigma(P)(2)-complete. (C) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On the complexity of non-unique probe selection
